metadata.title: Finding Ophthalmic Risk and Evaluating the Value of Eye exams and their predictive Reliability (FOREVER) - dataset
metadata.description:
The Finding Ophthalmic Risk and Evaluating the Value of Eye exams and their predictive Reliability (FOREVER) dataset was developed in a collaborative effort with Synoptik A/S under the supervision of a consortium of international partners. It consists of extensive eye examinations carried out in optician stores, questionnaire responses, and for a subpopulation blood pressure measurements and saliva samples.

In addition to the tabular examination data, e.g. intraocular pressure and visual acuity, the database consists of fundus images and optical coherence tomography (OCT) scans for a subset of the participants obtained through following data extraction methods:

  • Fundus images are in DICOM format and can be analysed in a custom viewer or using the raw data. In addition, we provide vascular and optic cup/disc measurements extracted by AutoMorph.
  • The raw OCT data are stored as Topcon .fda files and cannot be made available. However, the pixel arrays and segmentations can be extracted and provided in NumPy or DICOM format. Additionally, summary metrics are accessible in tabular format. The entire file can be viewed in Topcon IMAGEnet 6. 

All participant data is linked to the Danish National Health Registries with information about the participants' personal health history, including prescriptions and hospital diagnoses and procedure codes.

To date, about 8000 saliva samples have been collected accompanied by 80,000 participants. An overall description of the data collection methods is provided on the website of Project FOREVER and in the corresponding method paper.

As the dataset contains personal sensitive information, access to the dataset can only be granted after an application is submitted and approved by the steering group via this link.

After a positive decision, a data access contract will be signed between the two institutions. Authorized Users will then receive access to a secure compute environment. Please note that the data cannot be copied from the server, however, the access fee includes support for creating your personal subset of the dataset and assistance in moving necessary files onto the server. An overview of access fees is provided on the website. On the current platform it is possible to obtain access to an NVIDIA A100 GPU with a usage-based charge. 

The files attached to this Zenodo entry provide an overview of the variables included in the data. Please note that not all variables contain a value for each examination or participant. A complete overview of available entries is provided upon request.

If the dataset is used in a research project the results should be published and articles should cite the dataset as well as the related articles mentioned under Related Works.

metadata.title: Validation of Cleaning Procedures for Residual Determination of Drugs in Manufacturing
metadata.description: Cleaning validation is a crucial process in pharmaceutical manufacturing to ensure equipment is free from harmful residues from previous products, including active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), excipients, and cleaning agents. This process ensures consistent removal of residues, preventing cross-contamination and maintaining product quality and safety. Key aspects of cleaning validation include adhering to regulatory guidelines, using analytical techniques like HPLC and TOC analysis, selecting a "worst-case" product for validation, using sampling techniques like swab and rinse sampling, defining acceptable residue levels based on toxicity and daily dose, and establishing a detailed validation protocol. The importance of cleaning validation lies in preventing cross-contamination, ensuring product quality and safety, complying with regulations, protecting brand reputation, and reducing the risk of product recalls and other costly consequences associated with contamination. It is mandated by regulatory bodies like the FDA, EMA, and WHO to adhere to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Terbinafine, a synthetic allylamine antifungal drug, is highly lipophilic and tends to accumulate in skin, nails, and fatty tissues. It inhibits ergosterol synthesis by inhibiting the fungal squalene monooxygenase enzyme. Terbinafine hydrochloride was granted FDA approval on 30 December 1992.  Validating a cleaning procedure for residual drug determination in manufacturing aims to demonstrate that the process consistently removes drug residues from equipment to levels below predetermined acceptance criteria, preventing cross-contamination and ensuring product purity and safety. This involves establishing residue acceptance criteria, selecting appropriate analytical methods, developing a robust cleaning process, conducting validation studies, demonstrating reproducibility and repeatability, identifying potential risks, ensuring patient safety, meeting regulatory compliance, and maintaining product quality by preventing cross-ontamination between different drug products produced on the same equipment.

creators.name: Bhavana Bairagi*, Dr. Kamble Ravindra Keshavrao

keywords: Cleaning validation; Terbinafine hydrochloride; FDA; HPLC

data.title: Validation of Cleaning Procedures for Residual Determination of Drugs in Manufacturing

metadata.title: Redefining drug development: Analytics driving quality and compliance
metadata.description:
Drug substance development is a cornerstone of pharmaceutical manufacturing, serving as the basis for producing safe, effective, and compliant drug products. Central to this process is the integration of analytical support, which ensures adherence to stringent quality and regulatory standards. Analytical techniques, such as chromatography, spectroscopy, and dissolution testing, are pivotal in assessing the purity, potency, and stability of drug substances, enabling the establishment and maintenance of predefined test parameters and specifications throughout the product lifecycle.

Key to this process is the identification and control of critical quality attributes (CQAs), including impurity profiles, particle size, and dissolution rates, to ensure batch-to-batch consistency. Regulatory bodies such as the FDA, EMA, and ICH require the use of validated analytical methods, which provide accurate, precise, and reproducible results essential for regulatory submissions and market approval.

This article examines the indispensable role of analytical methods in drug substance development, focusing on their contribution to quality control, assurance, and regulatory compliance. It also explores the interplay between analytical method development and evolving regulatory landscapes. Emerging trends, such as Quality by Design (QbD) and green chemistry principles, are highlighted for their potential to enhance efficiency and sustainability in the development process. By bridging quality and compliance, analytical support not only ensures the safety and efficacy of drug substances but also contributes to the advancement of pharmaceutical innovation.

metadata.title: Internal Medicine Residents' Perceptions of Fosfomycin use – a Brief Report
metadata.description:
Abstract—

Background: Fosfomycin is approved by the FDA for treating uncomplicated cystitis caused by Escherichia coli and Enterococcus faecalis. However, it is often prescribed off-label for broader indications, with limited data on physician knowledge and practice patterns.

Methods: We surveyed residents in the Yale New Haven Internal Medicine Residency program across three teaching hospitals to assess awareness, prescribing habits, and perceived indications for fosfomycin.

Results: Seventy-eight residents responded (58% response rate); 89.7% were familiar with fosfomycin, and 71.4% had prescribed it. The most common indication was uncomplicated cystitis (94.3%), followed by pyelonephritis (41.4%) and prostatitis (32.9%). E. coli (71.4%) and Klebsiella pneumoniae (68.6%) were the most frequently selected organisms. Only 30% correctly identified uncomplicated cystitis as the sole FDA-approved indication, and no responses fully aligned with the approved spectrum of use.

Conclusion: Internal medicine trainees demonstrated significant gaps in knowledge regarding fosfomycin’s approved role. Educational efforts are needed to promote judicious prescribing and preserve its effectiveness against multidrug-resistant pathogens.

data.title: Internal Medicine Residents' Perceptions of Fosfomycin use – a Brief Report

metadata.title: Políticas públicas de educación inicial en el Ecuador
metadata.description: La Educación Inicial representa una etapa clave para el desarrollo integral de los niños y niñas, especialmente en sus primeros cinco años de vida. En Ecuador, diversas políticas públicas buscan garantizar el acceso a una educación inclusiva y de calidad, valorando la diversidad cultural y lingüística del país. Este artículo analiza el cumplimiento de dichas políticas, como la Ley Intersectorial de Primera Infancia y el Programa de Atención Familiar, en el fortalecimiento de la Educación Inicial. Asimismo, se abordan los principales desafíos que aún persisten, como la falta de infraestructura, la limitada formación docente y las desigualdades territoriales. Se propone la incorporación de enfoques pedagógicos transformadores, como la Pedagogía Crítica, que fomenten la participación activa y la equidad desde la primera infancia. La investigación destaca la necesidad de reforzar el compromiso estatal mediante políticas articuladas y estrategias educativas innovadoras que garanticen el desarrollo pleno de todos los niños, sin distinción de contexto.

data.title: Políticas públicas de educación inicial en el Ecuador

metadata.title: Optimized FDA Pump
metadata.description:
This file includes the 3D components of the proposed optimized FDA pump design.

  • Optimized FDA Pump_Assembly for CFD, Optimized FDA Pump_Impeller and Optimized FDA Pump_Volute files are for CFD analysis.
  • Rest of the files are for 3D printing and manufacturing.

metadata.title: Decoding regulatory & ethical future of Artificial Intelligence in the field of law
metadata.description:
Abstract

                Artificial Intelligence (AI) used in virtual assistance ,web search ,machine translation, autonomous vehicle, cyber security, healthcare, finance , education, finance etc. Research indicates that the integration of advanced technology has recently made its way into the legal landscape in India. This development proves to be advantageous for various legal processes such as e-legal discovery, document automation, data collection, contract analysis, and document review. India has not yet unveiled a regulatory framework for artificial intelligence, as it prioritizes the development of capabilities and the promotion of innovation. So that India doesn't have specific laws solely dedicated to artificial intelligence. Further discussed legislation like Information technology Act 2000, and Digital Personal Data Protection act 2023 which are introduced under the guidance of the ministry of electronics and information technology explained AI-related concerns and guides its responsible development and use. Author explains Patent act, 1970 and Copyright Act 1957 which provide protection for AI- related innovations, such as algorithms, software, datasets. In detailed research discussed the regulatory and ethical perspectives of utilizing artificial intelligence are key sectors in India .Even Compared India with other nations such as the U.K., U.S.A., and China in terms of addressing issues arising from the integration of Artificial intelligence in daily operations. Institutions such as the RBI, SEBI, CDSCO,   ICMR, FDA, and MHRA have implemented stringent measures to mitigate the risk of harm to the populace are explained. Artificial intelligence is an evolving advance technology which usage information sources from Cyber space to collect data and perform  variety of advance functions, including data modeling, data assessment, data analytic  to visualize, anticipate and apply logic. These capabilities of artificial intelligence make it a potent force for transformation in the contemporary digital realm. Thorough this research author prioritizes the significance of AI in various sectors such as healthcare, intellectual property, data privacy, criminal justice, human rights, and its diverse applications in trade and commerce. For this purpose, gather credible information from authoritative sources such as reference books, scholarly articles, and reputable online surveys, utilize online platforms and databases to gather comprehensive data. Research focused on utilization of AI addressing challenges and providing solutions.
keywords: Keywords:  Artificial Intelligence (AI), Virtual Assistance, Web Search, Machine Translation, Cyber Security, Healthcare Finance, Education,, E-legal Discovery, Document Automation

data.title: Decoding regulatory & ethical future of Artificial Intelligence in the field of law

metadata.title: Bayesian Functional Factor Analysis and Bayesian Functional Principal Component Analysis
metadata.description: This research explores the application of Functional Data Analysis (FDA) to uncover time-varying patterns in complex dynamic systems. FDA treats data as smooth, continuous functions rather than discrete observations, enabling the analysis of temporal dependencies and underlying dynamic structures. Building on this framework, we apply Bayesian Principal Component Analysis (BPCA) and Bayesian Factor Analysis (BFA) to enhance the study of time-dependent data. BPCA is extended to functional data to address challenges in dimensionality reduction for high-dimensional and noisy datasets, providing robust uncertainty quantification and improved interpretability of temporal principal components. Complementing this, BFA is applied at ten distinct time points, using smoothing splines to visualize dynamic factor loadings and scores, capturing the evolution of latent structures over time. Together, these Bayesian approaches advance our understanding of temporal correlations in dynamic systems, offering a flexible and detailed methodology for applications such as gene regulatory networks and other evolving processes.

meeting.title: Joint Statistical Meetings (JSM) 2025

data.title: Bayesian Functional Factor Analysis and Bayesian Functional Principal Component Analysis

metadata.title: Two new rarely collected species of Annonaceae from the Peruvian Amazon
metadata.description:
While preparing a taxonomic revision of the Neotropical genus Klarobelia Chatrou (Annonaceae), two species new to science – Klarobelia icoja S.Lara & Chatrou, sp. nov., and Malmea abscondita Chatrou & Gees, sp. nov. – were discovered. Both species are known from only two collections, made in Amazonian Peru.

We clarify their generic placement and taxonomic identity based on a comparison of morphological characters with previously described species and on molecular phylogenetic analysis of four plastid markers.

The conservation status of both species is assessed following IUCN criteria, and line drawings and distribution map are provided.

creators.name: Chatrou, Lars W.
